intro: Nitrosalsola syriaca, commonly known as Syrian nitrateweed, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, green to reddish leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Nitrosalsola syriaca is known for its ability to accumulate nitrates, which can make it toxic to livestock if ingested in large quantities.
